contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist |name =Die Trying |image = |caption = |alt = |image_size = |background =group_or_band |alias = |origin =[[Sacramento]], [[California]], [[United States]] |genre =[[Alternative metal]]<br>[[Post-grunge]] |years_active =2001â€“2007 |label = [[Island Records]] |associated_acts = |website = |current_members = |past_members = [[#Former members|Former members]] }} ==History== '''Die Trying''' was a four member [[Rock music|rock]] band formed in 2001 and based in [[Sacramento, California]]. After signing a contract with [[Island Records]] in 2002, they released their first single, "Oxygen's Gone", followed by their [[Die Trying (album)|self-titled debut album]] on June 10, 2003. [[Jacoby Shaddix]] of [[Papa Roach]] appears on the song "Conquer The World" from that album. The bands name comes from their relentless effort in trying to make it and willingness to do anything. They would either make it or "Die Trying." "Die Trying" (produced by Neal Avron) reached critical success having been on the Billboard Top Heatseeker Albums for 10 weeks with a peak position at No. 14. The lead single "Oxygen's Gone" received heavy video airplay on MTV, MTV2, and Fuse. It also was able to land spots on Billboard's Hot Mainstream Rock Tracks for 8 weeks with a peak position of No. 35, along with Billboard's Modern Rock Tracks for 6 weeks with a peak position of No. 29 Die Trying disbanded thanks to what the band states as "shitty management, drugs, lawsuits, band drama, and all kinds of bad luck" in 2004. August 10, 2007 Die Trying played a show at The Boardwalk in Orangvale, CA along with Another Damn Disappointment. On November 2, 2007 Die Trying played a show at The Boardwalk in Orangvale, CA. Though unverified, it can be inferred that Die Trying has broken up. There have been zero updates to the band's official MySpace in over a year. Joey Cunha (known by the stage name Joey Roxx) has gone on to join the hard rock band [[Burn Halo]], which is fronted by former-[[Eighteen Visions]] frontman [[James Stephen Hart|James Hart]]. Jack Sinamian is now the frontman of the band 80 Proof Riot. Quentin Garcia is now in the band Hero's Last Mission. Matt Conley is now in the band Raushi. ==Former members== * Jassen Jensen - [[vocals]] * Jack Sinamian - [[guitar]]/vocals * Matt Conley - [[drum kit|drums]] * Steve Avery - [[Bass guitar|bass]] * Quentin Garcia - bass * Craig Bennett - bass * [[Chad Ackerman]] - guitar * Shane Blay - guitar * Joey Cunha - guitar ==Discography== * ''Sparrows (EP)'' (2002) * ''[[Die Trying (album)|Die Trying]]'' (2003) * ''Die Young (Demo Tape)'' (2007) ==External links== *[http://www.myspace.com/dietryingsincityangels Sin City Angels] {{DEFAULTSORT:Die Trying (Band)}} [[Category:Musical groups established in 2001]] [[Category:Rock music groups from California]] [[Category:American post-grunge musical groups]] [[Category:Musical groups from Sacramento, California]]
